text:
Nancy Hatch Dupree (3 October 1927 – 9 September 2017) was an American historian whose work primarily focused on the history of modern Afghanistan. She was born in India to American parents.
Dupree went to Barnard College and Columbia University to study Chinese.
Dupree was the director of the Afghanistan Center at Kabul University in Afghanistan and author of five books that she compiled while studying the history of Afghanistan from 1962 until the late 1970s.
